div.p: The statewide school closure through April 30th has moved all districts in the state of Iowa and beyond to make decisions about continued learning for students. This is new territory for administrators, teachers, students and parents. With guidance from the Iowa Department of Education, Martensdale-St. Marys has made the decision to go forward with Voluntary Educational Enrichment Opportunities (VEEO) during this time (See attached FAQ from the Iowa Department of Education). This model allows flexibility in delivering instruction without the requirement to make up lost hours or days due to this pandemic.

All students and families PK-12 will receive weekly updates with instruction, resources, and learning activities from teachers on Mondays and Fridays. Tuesday-Thursday, teachers will be available to answer questions, provide reinstruction and feedback, and other means of support for voluntary student learning.

Teachers will provide VEEO to address all subject areas and appropriate standards based on the grade level or course work of their students. These can be review activities, new learning, or a combination of both. The platform teachers use is left up to the teacher, which might include email, a classroom app, Google classroom, Zoom, etc.

Letter grades and credit for students will be based on activities, tests, quizzes, and homework completed prior to the cancellation of school (March 12, 2020). High school courses (grades 9-12) will be assigned letter grades; we will not be using pass/fail denotations. Junior high elective courses that have previously used pass/fail denotations can continue to do so. Students will be allowed to redo any assignments, retake any assessments, and submit all work assigned prior to March 12, 2020 without penalty to improve their grade for the quarter and semester.

If you are in need of a device for your child to use, or need help locating and arranging for Internet service, please let your child’s principal know. We can make arrangements for pick up of a Chromebook from school if you do not have a device for your child to use at home. There are limited quantities and will be distributed on a first come, first-served basis. If Internet access is a problem, we will do our best to put you in touch with resources to assist with this as well. In addition, the school’s Internet and wi-fi is accessible from the parking lot and open to families at this time.

We do not want our plans for continuous learning to add stress to an already stressful situation. We will be flexible with all students and their needs. Please feel free to reach out to teachers with questions about learning activities and assistance. The administrative team is here to help as well.
Stay safe; we hope to be seeing you soon!

If you are unable to register online, please come to the Central Office at 8:00 a.m.
For your child to be signed up for preschool, you will have to fill out the form and pay the registration fee.
Registration fee amounts are posted with the registration.
